original: Arrander, Karl Axel Helge, muni-cipalläkare, Smögen, f. 3/8/99 i Ökna, Jönköp. i. G. 34 m. Karin Liliie Matilda Andersson. — Stud :ex. i Eksjö 19, med. kand. i Lund 34, med. lic. där 34. Kortare förordn. som e. läk. i ödeshögs. Vara, Ljungby, Nora, Odensbackens o. Älvängens distr. 39-34, assist :läk. v. Hörby las. 39, e. läk. v. Källshagens sjukh. 34, prakt. läk. i Munkedal 34-46, municip :iäk. i Smögen sed. 46, läk. v. Sunnervikens kommunaiförb. tuberk :sjukstuga v. Gläborg 36-44, vik. und :läk. v. Svens-högens i&anat. två mån. 36 o. 1 mån 41. Arrhén, Carl Erik Theodor, lektor, Uddevalla, f. 34/11/99 i Kristberg, Ös-tergötl. 1., av Theodor A. o. Agda Svartström. G. 34 m. Margareta Bæckström. Barn: Peter f. 37, Nils Olof 40^, Kerstin 45. — Stud:ex. i Västerås 19, fil. kand. i Upps. 33, fil. hc. 28, fil. dr 29, fil. mag. v. Sthlms högsk. 37, provår v. norra real i Sthlm 37-38. Stud:res. t. Belg., Danm., Engl., Estl., Finl., Frankr., Lettl., Lit, Norge, Polen, Schv^eiz o. Tyskl. Red. f. Nat. Tidn. o. Ungsv. Lösen 29-37, e. adj. i Bromma 38-40, lektor i Haparanda 40, lektor i hist. m. samh:lära o. geogr. v. Uddevalla h. a. 1. sed. 40. Ordf. i studrfören. Heimdal 28, i Sv:es konserv. stud. samorg. 28-29, i Konserv. Ungd. i Sthlm 33-37, därefter hed:led. där, ordf. i Parslam. gr. f. en europ. union 47, förste v. ordf. d högerns ungd :rör. Ungsvenskarna 34-36, led. av Sv. fam:värnets riksorg. överstyr. 41, av Gbgs o. Boh. 1. högerförb. arb:-utsk., av Herrestads komm ifudlm. 42-46, ordf. i beredn :nd 45, led. av riksd. första kamm. (h) sed. 43, led. av tillf, utsk., suppl. i konS’t :utsk., första lagut-sk. o. särs k. utsk. 46, ordf. i stift. Bo-hus-Po’Sten 43, led. av 41 års bef :ut-redn. deleg. f. socialped. frågor 44-46. Skr.: Den tyska parlamentarismens ut-veckl. under kejsardöme o. riksrepublik (29), Hitler, tysk nationalism o. nationalsocialism (32), Vitalis’ Norström — en vägrödjare f. sv. konservatism (33), Rudolf Kjellén o. unghögern (33), Pontus Fahlbeck o. isamhället (35), Behovts-lön eller ükalön ? (39), Krigets vardag (41), Befolkningsfrågan är vår ödesfråga (44), art. i Sv. uppsl :bok, tidn. o. tidskr., utg. högerns valhandbok 34, 36, 38, 40 o. 42. Sign.: Arrh., -rr-.
translated:
Arrander, Karl Axel Helge, municipal physician, Smögen, b. 3/8/99 in Ökna, Jönköp. Co. Married in 1934 to Karin Liliie Matilda Andersson. - Studied medical degree in Eksjö 1919, graduated in Lund as a medical candidate in 1934, and obtained a medical license in the same year. Worked as a doctor in various locations such as Ödeshög, Vara, Ljungby, Nora, Odensbacken, Älvängen districts from 1939-1943, became an assistant physician in Hörby Hospital and later a doctor at Källshagen Hospital in 1934. He also worked as a resident physician in Munkedal from 1934-1946, and then became a municipal physician in Smögen from 1946. He worked as a doctor at Sunnerviken Municipal Association Tuberculosis Hospital in Gläborg from 1936-1944 and then worked as a temporary assistant physician at Svenshögen Hospital for two months in 1936 and one month in 1941. 

Arrhén, Carl Erik Theodor, professor, Uddevalla, b. 34/11/99 in Kristberg, Östergötland, son of Theodor A. and Agda Svartström. Married in 1934 to Margareta Bæckström. Children: Peter b. 1937, Nils Olof b. 1940, Kerstin b. 1945. - Studied at Västerås in 1919, Uppsala University and became a Bachelor of Philosophy in 1933, received a doctorate in Philosophy in 1929, a Master of Philosophy at Stockholm University in 1937. He worked in numerous countries such as Belgium, Denmark, England, Estonia, Finland, France, Latvia, Lithuania, Norway, Poland, Switzerland, and Germany. He was also an editor for Nat. Tidn. and Ungsv. Lösen from 1929-1937, and an adjunct in Bromma from 1938-1940. He worked as a professor of history, social science, and geography at Uddevalla higher secondary school starting from 1940. He was the chairman of student organization Heimdal in 1928, Swedish Conservative Student Association in 1928-1929 and Stockholm Conservative Youth Group in 1933-1937, and thereafter became an honorary member there. He was also the chairman of Parslam Group for a European Union in 1947, first vice-chairman of the Young Swedes in 1934-1936, member of Svenska Fam:värnets National Organization Board in 1941, member of Göteborgs och Bohus County Right-wing Association Labor Committee, and Herrestads Municipal Government in Uddevalla from 1942-1946. He was the chairman of the Ministry of Defense in 1945, and member of the first Chamber of the Riksdag from 1943, substitute member of the Constitutional and Special Committees, the First Legislative Assembly, and the Special Church Committee in 1946. He was also the chairman of the Bohus-Po’Sten Foundation in 1943 and a member of the 1941 Defense Committee delegation on social pedagogy from 1944-1946. His publications include "The development of German parliamentarism under empire and republic" (1929), "Hitler, German nationalism, and National Socialism" (1932), "Vitalis' Norström - a road builder for Swedish conservatism" (1933), "Rudolf Kjellén and young conservatives" (1933), "Pontus Fahlbeck and society" (1935), "Needs salary or performance-based pay?" (1939), "The reality of war" (1941), and "The population issue is our destiny" (1944). He also wrote articles in the Swedish encyclopedia Uppslag and various other newspapers and magazines, and edited the right-wing election handbook in 1934, 1936, 1938, 1940, and 1942. Signature: Arrh., -rr-.
